titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale School of Drama Master of Fine Arts Theses
Yale School of Drama Master of Fine Arts Theses
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Hannah Rae Montgomery

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 23:01

did.unittitle: Yale School of Drama Master of Fine Arts Theses
did.abstract: This collection contains thesis projects submitted in partial fulfillment for the degree of Master of Fine Arts at the Yale School of Drama.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale School of Drama Master of Fine Arts Theses, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains thesis projects submitted in partial fulfillment for the degree of Master of Fine Arts at the Yale School of Drama.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Directing. II. Stage Management. III. Technical Design and Production. IV. Miscellaneous.

did.unittitle: Directing Theses

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes production books from third-year director's thesis projects, in partial fulfillment of requirements for the Master of Fine Arts degree in Directing at the Yale School of Drama.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series is arranged chronologically by year of completion, then alphabetically by author surname within each year.

Stage Management Theses

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes theses by third-year stage managers, in partial fulfillment of requirements for the Master of Fine Arts degree in Stage Management at the Yale School of Drama.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is divided into two subseries: I. Production Theses (acting editions/production books for productions staged); and II. Written Theses (research and critical analysis on a faculty-approved topic in theatre history or practice). Both subseries are arranged chronologically by year of completion, then alphabetically by author surname within each year.

scopecontent.p: Box 24 also contains "A Project in Architectural Lighting," which is another work by Lyndersay.

Technical Design and Production Theses

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes theses by third-year Technical Design and Production students, in partial fulfillment of requirements for the Master of Fine Arts degree in Technical Design and Production at the Yale School of Drama.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series is arranged chronologically by year of completion, then alphabetically by author surname within each year.
